description.narrative: BZU/MDC kommer att arbeta för att uppnå en mer organiserad, oberoende, professionell och pluralistisk mediasektor i Palestina, genom att operationalisera den nationella media strategin (NMS) som tagits fram. BZU/MDC kommer att arbeta med alla relevanta nationella intressenter, både ansvarsbärare och rättighetsinnehavare inom hela sektorn. Utbildare, redaktörer, journalister och mediestudenter kommer att delta genom att genomföra normer och regelverk som utvecklats i den nya nationella media strategin.

BZU/MDC will work to achieve a more organized, independent, professional and pluralistic Media sector in Palestine, by operationalizing the National Media Strategy (NMS) through working with all relevant national stakeholders, both duty bearers and rights holders across the sector. Trainers, editors, journalists and media students will be involved to implement the standards and procedures developed in the NMS.

The intended long-term outcome of MDC´s four year strategy was that "Effect on the media sector, that will lead to a more competent society that will hold the state accountable, which will lead to an increased democratization process".The long-term outcome was supported by three strategic goals/intermediate outcomes, of which the intervention in question supported the first two. The three goals were:1) Palestinians in the West Bank, Gaza Strip, East Jerusalem, and Area C are empowered to critically engage in exercising their right to freedom of expression as a basic human right. 2) National stakeholders utilize high quality, specialized and diverse range of services/Products/policies/research. 3) Initiating media integration in the Euro-Mediterranean region. (Not Supported)

participating-org.narrative: The Palestinian Media Development Program/Birzeit University

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
5.b - Enhance the use of enabling technology, in particular information and communications technology, to promote the empowerment of women.
5.b - Öka användningen av gynnsam teknik, i synnerhet informations- och kommunikationsteknik, för att främja kvinnors egenmakt

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Examples of results achieved by MDC include but were not limited to: Worked with the National Task Force of more than 130 members from the West Bank and Gaza Strip from government duty bearers, private sector, and civil society organizations, on the development of the National Media Strategy and National Initiative on Media Development. Increased their visibility on the national, regional and international levels by participation in various activites, such as being nominated to represent Arab radios in the global summit for children in Malaysia, and conducting a regional training for Egypt, Jordan and Lebanon upon the request of the World Association of News Publishers (WAN – IFRA). Completed developing, designing and printing the economic journalism course and the cultural journalism course, both of which were to be taught at 20 universities and colleges. Launched the Media Literacy Project aimed at developing media literacy for both journalists and non-media professionals. Organized a meeting between the President of the Anti-Corruption Commission and journalists in Gaza via Skype, in order to encourage partnerships between the Commission and media institutions. Held training sessions in the West Bank and Gaza Strip on a range of topics and technical skills such as producing quality professional productions, television program production, digital storytelling, lighting techniques, radio broadcasting, mobile journalism and social media uses for people with disabilities. During the pandemic and upon the request of the Prime Minister’s Office, MDC prepared a weekly report with recommendations for the work of the formal and informal media during the crisis, as well as suggestions that should be followed by the Prime Minister. Within the training and qualification program for new university graduates in Palestine and preparing them for the labor market, funded by the Arab Fund for Economic and Social Development, MDC implemented a course on economics and business journalism for graduates from universities and colleges that teach media. Received official approval to launch a professional diploma specializing in digital media from the Accreditation and Quality Authority of the Ministry of Education and Higher Education. With the aim of diversifying their financial resources and decreasing their financial vulnerability following the end of Sweden's core support, MDC submitted many proposals and concept papers to various potential partners and donors. Some of which were accepted, and for example in 2019, more funds were raised than planned.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
